comments.author: ankitdhanna
comments.body:
It can happen that someone found it and deposited in the lost and found box placed throughout the city.

You can search in their website or physically go there 

https://www.wien.gv.at/verwaltung/fundservice/

comments.author: walee1
comments.body: Did you not have the find my app (if I recall correctly) on the phone from IPhone? If so you can use that to locate the phone, provided it is still powered on.

comments.author: No_Price_6717
comments.body: i am one of those people who turn their phone off altogether at the movies and i hate myself for it :(

comments.author: kogamas
comments.body:
>Well even then you can try using the desktop version of the app to set a message that will be displayed if someone finds it and turns it on as well as pinging you when it is turned on. Sorry not super familiar with iPhones as I don't use them but hope it helps you

IPhones can even be found if turned off!

comments.author: walee1
comments.body:
Well even then you can try using the desktop version of the app to set a message that will be displayed if someone finds it and turns it on as well as pinging you when it is turned on. Sorry not super familiar with iPhones as I don't use them but hope it helps you


ETA: https://www.apple.com/icloud/find-my/


You can view the info there
